title: Symfony 8 on PHP 8.4: FrankenPHP vs RoadRunner Benchmarked
partialText: Discover which PHP runtime leads the pack in Symfony 8. Compare FrankenPHP and RoadRunner benchmarks to optimize your applicationâ€™s performance.

title: The Case for Slow, Sustainable Engineering
partialText: A letter to engineers arguing for slow, sustainable softwareâ€”and against the â€œwartimeâ€ myth that turns tech into a race powered by greed and fear.

title: Growth Hacking Is Dead - Systems Are Eating Marketing
partialText: Growth hacking was once a simple way to find a high-leverage tactic and grow. But the environment has fundamentally changed and tactics are no longer repeatable. Marketing teams are now chasing new tools and new tricks.

title: Looking Back at the Changes That Rust 1.77.1 Brought In
partialText: Rust 1.77.1 therefore disables the new Cargo behavior on Windows for targets that use MSVC. There are no changes for other targets. We plan to eventually re-enable debuginfo stripping in release mode in a later Rust release.

title: Courts Are Drowning in Cases. Can AI Save the Day Without Becoming a Liability?
partialText: Artificial intelligence (AI) is being used in courts around the world to speed up proceedings and reduce administrative burdens. But the growing presence of AI in justice systems raises urgent questions. How should it be regulated? How far can automation go without undermining due process? And who is accountable when AI tools influence judicial outcomes?

title: A Face Scan Could Be Required if You're Touring a Rental
partialText: Landlords are asking renters to submit to 3D facial recognition scans to verify their identity. Some landlords also use facial recognition incorporated into smart lockboxes.

title: Designing for AI Agents
partialText: An agent does not wait for instruction. It monitors context, forms intentions, takes actions, and adapts its strategy over time.

title: Judging the Future of Mobile AI: An Interview with Ivan Mishchenko
partialText: As artificial intelligence becomes deeply embedded in mobile applications, the role of engineering judgment is changing.

title: Lorentzian Logic: Solving Unknown Cluster Numbers via Differentiable Graph Entropy
partialText: Optimize network analysis with LSEnet, a deep learning model that eliminates the need to predefined cluster numbers. By leveraging the Lorentz model of hyperbolic space and differentiable structural information, it identifies optimal hierarchies through self-organized gradient backpropagation.

title: LSEnet: Mastering Automated Data Grouping in Curved Hyperbolic Space
partialText: Meet LSEnet, the neural net that organizes complex networks into optimal partitioning trees using the Lorentz model. By ditching flat Euclidean space for curved hyperbolic geometry, it recursively learns parent nodes using a self-supervised clustering objective.

title: Smart Data Grouping: LSEnet & Automated Graph Clustering in Curved Space
partialText: Stop guessing your cluster numbers. Discover LSEnet, a deep graph clustering model that uses Differentiable Structural Information (DSI) and the Lorentz model of hyperbolic space to organize complex networks automatically.

title: Smart Graph Clustering: Organizing Networks Automatically
partialText: Explore the frontier of geometric deep learning and non-Euclidean optimization. Master Kuramoto model training, hyperbolic reinforcement learning, and deep graph clustering without predefined cluster numbers using LSEnet and Structural Entropy.

title: I'm Building a Tower Defense Game Where VCs Are the Enemy
partialText: StartupTD is a browser-based tower defense game with a simple premise: survive as long as possible while your startup gets attacked by increasingly difficult waves of enemies. Each enemy type represents a real threat that startups face: Big Tech Clones, Bugs, and VCs.

title: 5 Marvel Characters That Are Surprisingly Not in the MCU (Yet)
partialText: The Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) has been ongoing since 2008. Here are 5 characters that have yet to make their MCU debut. Black Cat, Squirrel Girl, Gwenpool, Miles Morales and Beta Ray Bill make the list.

title: Brand-Safe Image Gen: Custom LoRAs With qwen-image-trainer-v2
partialText: qwen-image-trainer-v2 is a LoRA trainer for fine-tuning Qwen image models fastâ€”train styles, objects, and brand-ready adapters without full retraining.

title: The Fastest Way to Prototype Agents: Declare the â€œWhat,â€ Let ADK Run the â€œHowâ€
partialText: The complexity of imperative coding is currently a major bottleneck in deploying AI agents. This article introduces Ackgent, a production-ready starter kit that leverages the new Agent Config feature in Google ADK (v1.12.0+) to shift development toward a declarative paradigm. Instead of writing intricate Python boilerplate for execution and state management, developers can now define agent behaviors, tools, and multi-agent orchestration using simple YAML files. By combining this approach with modern tooling like uv and just, Ackgent offers a faster, more accessible path to building scalable agents on Google Cloud Run, paving the way for a future where agent creation is accessible to non-technical builders.

title: GLM-OCR Explained: Promptable OCR That Outputs Clean JSON
partialText: A beginner-friendly guide to GLM-OCR: promptable, layout-aware OCR that extracts text, tables, formulas, and structured JSON from complex documents.

title: Turn Text Into Narration Fast With MiniMax Speech-2.8 HD
partialText: Need natural-sounding TTS? MiniMax Speech-2.8 HD on fal.ai generates high-quality speech from text with voice selectionâ€”plus tips for testing tones and A/B variants.

title: DaVinci-Agency: A Shortcut to Long-Horizon AI Agents
partialText: DaVinci-Agency uses existing language models to generate diverse synthetic trajectories, training long-horizon agents that plan and execute multi-step tasks with far less human data.
